document.docAuthor: Mejdalani, Gabriel, Domahovski, Alexandre C. & Cavichioli, Rodney R.
document.masterDocTitle: The sharpshooter genus Aguana: taxonomic notes, two new species from Brazil, the female of A. imbricata, and updated key (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellini)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The sharpshooter genus Aguana: taxonomic notes, two new species from Brazil, the female of A. imbricata, and updated key (Hemiptera: Cicadellidae: Cicadellini)

subSubSection.paragraph:
Head and thorax ( Figs 1–3 ) much as described by Young (1977: 37) for the genus and in the diagnosis given above. Forewing venation ( Figs 16–19 ), especially crossveins, shows considerable intraspecific variation. Color as in
Figs 1–3
and 16–19 ; apical half of crown with median triangular yellowish-brown or orange marking; forewing vermiculations and spots predominantly yellowish-brown and large posterior spots predominantly yellow.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 1–15.
Aguana imbricata (Signoret, 1854)
, male. 1. Body, dorsal view. 2. Body, lateral view. 3. Face, frontal view. 4. Genital capsule, lateral view. 5. Pygofer process, ventral view. 6. Pygofer process, posterior view. 7. Valve and subgenital plate, ventral view. 8. Connective and style, dorsal view. 9. Paraphyses, ventral view. 10. Aedeagus, lateral view. 11. Aedeagus, ventral view. 12–15. Variations in the aedeagal processes.

FIGURES 16–19.
Aguana imbricata (Signoret, 1854)
, forewing. Variations in the venation.
